programme.title: Unknown
Unknown Identity
programme.desc: Unknown: Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra. With Liam Neeson, Diane Kruger, January Jones, Aidan Quinn. When a man awakens from a coma only to discover that someone has taken on his identity, he teams up with a young woman to prove who he is." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1401152/","name":"Unknown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA4NTk3MTQwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjUwMTMxNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a man awakens from a coma only to discover that someone has taken on his identity, he teams up with a young woman to prove who he is.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1401152/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"uorrett"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Keeps your attention","reviewBody":"Anyone who has watched Liam Neeson's movies have grown accustom to a character that is always thrown into absurd situations but can still somehow use wit, power and skills to get himself out. Unknown offers the same formula but it still works. This movie caught my attention from the get go. I enjoy how Liam is believable in these roles and you forget that he's getting up there in age, if anything, he makes it seem like this is what any man his age is capable of. He is awaken from a coma to discover that his identity has been taken by someone else. Worst yet, his wife doesn't seem to recognize him. With the help of the woman that saved his life, in a country that is not his home, Liam seeks about to prove himself. This movie is action packed and keeps you on the edge while you try to figure out what is going on. And I feel the ending does not disappoint. Enjoyable, entertaining, action packed and thrilling!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":256985,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2011-03-23","keywords":"amnesia,coma,airport,scientist,nurse","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Unknown: International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1552980505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA4NjYwMDYzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1NTgyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA4NjYwMDYzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1NTgyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man awakens from a coma, only to discover that someone has taken on his identity and that no one, (not even his wife), believes him. With the help of a young woman, he sets out to prove who he is. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000553/","name":"Liam Neeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1208167/","name":"Diane Kruger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005064/","name":"January Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1429471/","name":"Jaume Collet-Serra"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050870/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124700/","name":"Oliver Butcher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0180508/","name":"Stephen Cornwell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0885857/","name":"Didier Van Cauwelaert"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Monster Hunter
Monster Hunter
programme.desc:
Monster Hunter: Directed by Paul W.S. Anderson. With Milla Jovovich, Tony Jaa, Ron Perlman, T.I.. When Cpt. Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Feature film based on the video game by Capcom." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6475714/","name":"Monster Hunter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU3NTFmNjYtODc3Ny00MWEzLWI3M2ItZjE3NDgwMTI0MzkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"When Cpt. Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Feature film based on the video game by Capcom.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6475714/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Impartial-Reviewer"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"A B Level Film With A Blockbuster Graphics Level.","reviewBody":"A film based on the game franchise "Monster Hunter", where it tells a story of Lt. Artemis who finds herself along with her soldiers teleported to another world full of Mega sized monsters and her attempt to return to our world.

As simple and silly as it may sound, that's pretty much the story here. An equation that almost everyone in Western cinema world and mainly Hollywood fails to understand...when a Game or a Film is created in a certain country in the world and it's a major success, it "Never" means that it'll receive the same success once it gets disfigured by the western touch! Not like ever...I can easily rename the disastrous experiences which clearly no one learns from them. From Resident Evil to Godzilla...etc or even the Ugliness of Hollywood Horror remakes like in the Grudge, Quarantine or The Ring...etc. Each country of cultures adds its own flavor to their films! Even if you insist on remaking a film, stick to the authenticity, Stop shoving fking Americans blindly in every remake and Don't change neither genders nor races in which only ruins the adaptation integrity.

Monster Hunter is a vivid example of such. The film started good, there's absolutely No need for Lt. bs and her pointless platoon! The film could have been authentic and true to the heart of the game if it focused and continued the path of the first few minutes. The film can averagely only be enjoyed by the Monster Hunter Games fans, to me the first 4 mins was Good then followed by bad plot, limited acting skills, lazy script, mindless action and a wide open ending in hope for a second part.

The only good element in this is just the CGI other than that the directing and makeup was a joke...least to say The Admiral looks like an old drag queen, Lt. Artemis and her soldier driver "Dash" never loss their makeup or hair style regardless of the storms, fights with Diablos...etc, Not to mention Dash's fake eyelashes and she's a soldier in battle ffs.

Monster Hunter is a sad and silly mindless fun to kill time without any authenticity to the games which completely lacks the deserved respect to the elements of intelligence of the games fans base."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"based on video game,parallel world,female soldier,written by director,military","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi638763289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmEyM2JkN2ItNmQ3NS00ZTkzLWEwMjYtZmU1YmJlODczZWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmEyM2JkN2ItNmQ3NS00ZTkzLWEwMjYtZmU1YmJlODczZWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Behind our world, there is another: a world of dangerous and powerful monsters that rule their domain with deadly ferocity. When an unexpected sandstorm transports Captain Artemis (Milla Jovovich) and her unit (TI Harris, Meagan Good, Diego Boneta) to a new world, the soldiers are shocked to discover that this hostile and unknown environment is home to enormous and terrifying monsters immune to their firepower. In their desperate battle for survival, the unit encounters the mysterious Hunter (Tony Jaa), whose unique skills allow him to stay one step ahead of the powerful creatures. As Artemis and Hunter slowly build trust, she discovers that he is part of a team led by the Admiral (Ron Perlman). Facing a danger so great it could threaten to destroy their world, the brave warriors combine their unique abilities to band together for the ultimate showdown."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000170/","name":"Milla Jovovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1388074/","name":"Tony Jaa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000579/","name":"Ron Perlman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. Anderson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014411/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065386/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. Anderson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724522/","name":"Kaname Fujioka"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

Facing a danger so great it could threaten to destroy their world, the brave warriors combine their unique abilities to band together for the ultimate showdown.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000170/","name":"Milla Jovovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1388074/","name":"Tony Jaa","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000579/","name":"Ron Perlman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. programme.title: Chaos
Chaos
programme.desc: Chaos: Directed by Tony Giglio. With Jason Statham, Ryan Phillippe, Wesley Snipes, Henry Czerny. Two cops, a rookie and a grizzled vet, pursue an accomplished bank robber." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0402910/","name":"Chaos","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NDU0MTgyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjgwMzY4NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two cops, a rookie and a grizzled vet, pursue an accomplished bank robber.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0402910/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DxB_PiRaTe"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Cast......Good movie!","reviewBody":"I went to this movie with the lowest expectations and i just thought i would see a van dammed type of movie. But I was in for a surprise. The movie has good twists and action, I really loved the acting from Jasom Statham who is a really good actor! If you are an action movies fan then you shouldn't miss this movie... and don't think this movie is an all action movie, the story is well written and the twists are well made. I'd say go for it if you don't know which movie to watch!\n\nThe movie starts with Jason Statham out of the force. So then they had to get him back because of a bank robbery and the bad guys asked for him. Something bad happens in the Bank, then the cops are after the bad guys looking for them. You will have to keep a close eye at the movie, it's a good action thriller that you will not expect to be as good as it is!! and after this movie i'll proudly say i'm a huge fan of Jason Statham (Snatch, Lock Stock and two Smoking Barrels, Transporter, Transporter 2, Cellular, CHAOS), this guy is just amazing!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53949,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-11-08","keywords":"chaos theory,power outage,investigation,exploding house,hanging upside down","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000202/","name":"Ryan Phillippe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000648/","name":"Wesley Snipes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317638/","name":"Tony Giglio"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125996/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0313720/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0313752/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317638/","name":"Tony Giglio"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Ron Perlman, John Hurt, Selma Blair, Rupert Evans, Karel Roden

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
Hellboy 2: Die goldene Armee
programme.desc:
Hellboy II: The Golden Army: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Ron Perlman, Selma Blair, Doug Jones, John Alexander. A prince of the mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth. Hellboy and his team must fight to stop him from locating the all-powerful Golden Army." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0411477/","name":"Hellboy II: The Golden Army","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NzgyMjc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU3MDI3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A prince of the mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth. Hellboy and his team must fight to stop him from locating the all-powerful Golden Army.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0411477/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vip_ebriega"},"dateCreated":"2009-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Take another trip to Del Toro's labyrinth.","reviewBody":"My Take: An elaborate set of imaginative creature effects and the always interesting lead character make the show worth watching.

I have a confession to make: I haven't seen the original HELLBOY yet. And neither have I seen it when I saw the much-praised sequel HELLBOY II: THE GOLDEN ARMY. But that's just what I really like about this sequel: It doesn't require you to have seen the original to fully enjoy this weird and entertaining excursion. Seeing the original would certainly add to the experience, but taken in its own rights, HELLBOY II does what a sequel should do: Not just live up to the expectations left by its predecessor, but also shine as a stand-alone effort.

And yet I have another confession: I have not seen Guillermo Del Toro's crown jewel PAN'S LABYRINTH yet. But seeing HELLBOY II, I am more than impressed by his wild imagination. HELLBOY may have been based on a comic book, but for anyone who isn't a fan of the comics, Hellboy is Del Toro's own creation. Like what Tim Burton did with BATMAN, Del Toro has modeled Hellboy (Ron Perlman) as his own creation on-screen, and he's a very interesting character. Perlman never wastes his opportunity to provide depth as well as nuance to his character. Perlman proves himself worthy, not just an ideal action hero (under tons of make-up), but as yet another actor who successfully embodies the role of a comic-book character.

As in PAN'S LABYRINTH, Del Toro populates the world of HELLBOY II with some truly fascinating and intriguing creatures. Roger Ebert made a truthful compliment by stating that the world of HELLBOY II reminded him of the famous Cantina scene from STAR WARS. What George Lucas has conceived within only a few minutes of screen time in his movie, Del Toro manages to do for 2 hours. The creatures are imaginative, not just in look but in personality, and they are at an abundance. Plus, they're also mostly done using make-up effects rather than CGI, which makes them all the more real. Add to Del Toro's imaginative set pieces, he is a master storyteller. From the opening scene, where "Broom" Bruttenholm (John Hurt) tells the legend of the "Golden Army" to a young Hellboy, Del Toro exhibits is true talents at telling a good story. There are moments of thrills and even laughs, and the visuals are superb. Supporting performances and some neat special effects (notice that I praised the CGI later in in this review) make for one worthy adventure ride. HELLBOY II isn't perfect, but it sure is great at what it was doing.

Rating: **** out of 5.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":264421,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2008-10-08","keywords":"superhero,twins,friendship,cat,elf","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. teaser trailer: Hellboy II: The Golden Army","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1588723993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIwMDU5MjI5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjM2ODc5._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIwMDU5MjI5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjM2ODc5._V1_.jpg","description":"This is a teaser trailer for Hellboy II: The Golden Army, directed by Guillermo del Toro"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000579/","name":"Ron Perlman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004757/","name":"Selma Blair"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427964/","name":"Doug Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020061/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239918/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0586005/","name":"Mike Mignola"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

Feature film based on the video game by Capcom.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6475714/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Impartial-Reviewer"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"A B Level Film With A Blockbuster Graphics Level.","reviewBody":"A film based on the game franchise "Monster Hunter", where it tells a story of Lt. Artemis who finds herself along with her soldiers teleported to another world full of Mega sized monsters and her attempt to return to our world.

As simple and silly as it may sound, that's pretty much the story here. An equation that almost everyone in Western cinema world and mainly Hollywood fails to understand...when a Game or a Film is created in a certain country in the world and it's a major success, it "Never" means that it'll receive the same success once it gets disfigured by the western touch! Not like ever...I can easily rename the disastrous experiences which clearly no one learns from them. From Resident Evil to Godzilla...etc or even the Ugliness of Hollywood Horror remakes like in the Grudge, Quarantine or The Ring...etc. Each country of cultures adds its own flavor to their films! Even if you insist on remaking a film, stick to the authenticity, Stop shoving fking Americans blindly in every remake and Don't change neither genders nor races in which only ruins the adaptation integrity.

Monster Hunter is a vivid example of such. The film started good, there's absolutely No need for Lt. bs and her pointless platoon! The film could have been authentic and true to the heart of the game if it focused and continued the path of the first few minutes. The film can averagely only be enjoyed by the Monster Hunter Games fans, to me the first 4 mins was Good then followed by bad plot, limited acting skills, lazy script, mindless action and a wide open ending in hope for a second part.

The only good element in this is just the CGI other than that the directing and makeup was a joke...least to say The Admiral looks like an old drag queen, Lt. Artemis and her soldier driver "Dash" never loss their makeup or hair style regardless of the storms, fights with Diablos...etc, Not to mention Dash's fake eyelashes and she's a soldier in battle ffs.

Monster Hunter is a sad and silly mindless fun to kill time without any authenticity to the games which completely lacks the deserved respect to the elements of intelligence of the games fans base."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"based on video game,parallel world,female soldier,written by director,military","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi638763289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmEyM2JkN2ItNmQ3NS00ZTkzLWEwMjYtZmU1YmJlODczZWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmEyM2JkN2ItNmQ3NS00ZTkzLWEwMjYtZmU1YmJlODczZWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Behind our world, there is another: a world of dangerous and powerful monsters that rule their domain with deadly ferocity. When an unexpected sandstorm transports Captain Artemis (Milla Jovovich) and her unit (TI Harris, Meagan Good, Diego Boneta) to a new world, the soldiers are shocked to discover that this hostile and unknown environment is home to enormous and terrifying monsters immune to their firepower. In their desperate battle for survival, the unit encounters the mysterious Hunter (Tony Jaa), whose unique skills allow him to stay one step ahead of the powerful creatures. As Artemis and Hunter slowly build trust, she discovers that he is part of a team led by the Admiral (Ron Perlman). Facing a danger so great it could threaten to destroy their world, the brave warriors combine their unique abilities to band together for the ultimate showdown."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000170/","name":"Milla Jovovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1388074/","name":"Tony Jaa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000579/","name":"Ron Perlman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. Anderson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014411/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065386/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. programme.title: Raw Deal
Der City-Hai
programme.desc: Raw Deal: Directed by John Irvin. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Kathryn Harrold, Sam Wanamaker, Paul Shenar. A former FBI agent turned small-town sheriff agrees to help the FBI chief infiltrate the Chicago mafia when the FBI chief's son is killed by them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0091828/","name":"Raw Deal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTVkNWIwZmYtMzM5MS00ZTcwLWI0ZjEtNTVlMTNjZWViNzliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A former FBI agent turned small-town sheriff agrees to help the FBI chief infiltrate the Chicago mafia when the FBI chief's son is killed by them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0091828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dworldeater"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"It is the audience that gets a raw deal from this troubled production","reviewBody":"In Arnold's best period of his film career, it is unquestionable that Raw Deal is his worst film from that era. Sandwiched between two of his best action movies, Commando and Predator. Raw Deal is real weak by comparison. The film is a mess and it seemed that those involved with the production could not agree on what they were making. Also, it would appear that funds were too low for anyone's vision to get on screen. The editing and music for this movie is really poorly done. This film is definitely lacking in a consistent tone or focus. The action scenes seem out of place as well. Raw Deal was probably meant to be a low budget police thriller. Any way you slice it, this film is not a cohesive piece of work and is filled with plot holes. Arnold, at this point in his career had massive physicality and charisma. However, he was lacking in acting skills and was horrendous in the more dramatic scenes here. The supporting cast was pretty good for the most part. Even though this is not Arnie's highest quality production, it still remains fairly entertaining. There is quite a bit of funny stuff here(some intentional and some not). Also, there is plenty of Arnold one liners with one of my favorites, "You should not drink and bake". While Raw Deal is not a well made movie, it is not totally unwatchable and is still quite amusing and outrageous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33406,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1986-06-06","keywords":"gang war,undercover,infiltration,shootout,violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi572373529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNkNGFlZDctOWMxMS00Njg4LTgwY2EtYTU5MTM0ZDI0ZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNkNGFlZDctOWMxMS00Njg4LTgwY2EtYTU5MTM0ZDI0ZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000216/","name":"Arnold Schwarzenegger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002130/","name":"Kathryn Harrold"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0910737/","name":"Sam Wanamaker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0410139/","name":"John Irvin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046277/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036611/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0490761/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0898812/","name":"Luciano Vincenzoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006872/","name":"Sergio Donati"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222904/","name":"Gary DeVore"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hellboy 2: Die goldene Armee
programme.desc: Zauberhaft fantastisch: Der "Pans Labyrinth"-Macher schickt zum zweiten Mal den teuflischen Comic-Helden Hellboy auf Monsterjagd. Oscar fürs Make-up. – Der Frieden zwischen den Menschen und den Kreaturen der mystischen Welt ist gestört. Denn Prinz Nuada (Luke Goss) erklärt der Menschheit den Krieg. Die US-Regierung alarmiert das Bureau of Paranormal Research and Defense. Hellboy (Ron Perlman) und seine Kollegen stehen vor einer schwierigen Aufgabe. Denn Nuada hat die Kampfmaschinen der Goldenen Armee zum Leben erweckt.

programme.title: Those Who Wish Me Dead
They Want Me Dead
programme.desc:
Those Who Wish Me Dead: Directed by Taylor Sheridan. With Angelina Jolie, Finn Little, Jon Bernthal, Aidan Gillen. A teenage murder witness finds himself pursued by twin assassins in the Montana wilderness with a survival expert tasked with protecting him -- and a forest fire threatening to consume them all." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3215824/","name":"Those Who Wish Me Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDAxMmQ0NTAtNDllNC00ZjE2LTlkNjUtMmExNmY0MmNkMDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzYyOTM1ODI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenage murder witness finds himself pursued by twin assassins in the Montana wilderness with a survival expert tasked with protecting him -- and a forest fire threatening to consume them all.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3215824/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Movi3DO"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Average although decent thrill","reviewBody":"A brand new movie just added to HBO Max. A traumatized and retired firefighter who had to protect a boy from those who wish him dead.

When I saw the trailer, I expected a pretty simple thriller. And I was right. The trailer showed most of the story. The plot was seen a bunch of times before, so there wasn't any surprises here.

The acting was pretty decent across the board. There wasn't much complex emotion or scenes that required these actors to show their best.

Even though the plot was simple, I still wanted a decent thriller, and the movie gave me that. There were some pretty okay and intense action scenes, and they were handled well.

My biggest problem was the characters. At the beginning, the movie showed the event that traumatized the main character, played by Jolie. However, I did not see the significance of this event to the story at all. It didn't impact her character when she was in the action scenes.

Besides the main character, there were minimal development to the other characters. Jon Bernthal was badass as usual, but I didn't care for his character much, or any other characters.

Overall, a decent thriller, but everything else was average and not memorable. There's no need to watch this movie. 6/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51285,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-05-06","keywords":"female protagonist,survival,wildfire,assassin,fire tower","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1284292633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3YjQwMjgtNmE0Ny00ZjQyLWIwMWMtZTQxNWY4MDU1NDJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3YjQwMjgtNmE0Ny00ZjQyLWIwMWMtZTQxNWY4MDU1NDJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"While reeling from the loss of three lives she failed to save in a fire, smoke jumper Hannah comes across a traumatized 12-year-old boy with nowhere else to turn."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396558/","name":"Nicholas Hoult"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7567974/","name":"Finn Little"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792263/","name":"Taylor Sheridan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465018/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4509289/","name":"Michael Koryta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495378/","name":"Charles Leavitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792263/","name":"Taylor Sheridan"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

When I saw the trailer, I expected a pretty simple thriller. And I was right. The trailer showed most of the story. The plot was seen a bunch of times before, so there wasn't any surprises here.

The acting was pretty decent across the board. There wasn't much complex emotion or scenes that required these actors to show their best.

Besides the main character, there were minimal development to the other characters. Jon Bernthal was badass as usual, but I didn't care for his character much, or any other characters.

Overall, a decent thriller, but everything else was average and not memorable. programme.title: Sniper: Assassin's End
Sniper: Assassin's End
programme.desc:
Sniper: Assassin's End: Directed by Kaare Andrews. With Chad Michael Collins, Sayaka Akimoto, Tom Berenger, Ryan Robbins. Legendary sniper Thomas Beckett and his son, Special Ops Sniper Brandon Beckett, are on the run from the CIA, Russian Mercenaries, and a Yakuza-trained assassin with sniper skills that rival both legendary sharp shooters." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12305696/","name":"Sniper: Assassin's End","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNlNzBhNzMtNWNiOC00MGMxLWI3YjktNWMwNzJjMDEyZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzY1ODU1OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Legendary sniper Thomas Beckett and his son, Special Ops Sniper Brandon Beckett, are on the run from the CIA, Russian Mercenaries, and a Yakuza-trained assassin with sniper skills that rival both legendary sharp shooters.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12305696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"OzMovieWatcher"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"The worst of Sniper series","reviewBody":"What can I say.... watched it to the end, did not hit fast forward at anytime, but it was no masterpiece. A B-grade movie

I found the dialogue and scene flow poor. Difficult to relate to the characters. Mostly just action. Found the story line very predictable... no surprises.

The tactical errors done by police were far too many for me to mention in goofs on this page. For example, swat teams entering a kill zone at almost shoulder to shoulder distancing. Only remotely resembled how real police conduct themselves in a combat zone. This is the worst of Sniper series.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2017,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-09-09","keywords":"sniper,narrow escape,special ops,trade agreement,blood splatter","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sniper: Assassin's End","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi87539225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE2MzAzMzUtZDJhNS00MWQ4LTgzOGUtNTkwYmM2NDg3MGUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE2MzAzMzUtZDJhNS00MWQ4LTgzOGUtNTkwYmM2NDg3MGUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1792864/","name":"Chad Michael Collins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2687122/","name":"Sayaka Akimoto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000297/","name":"Tom Berenger"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1543846/","name":"Kaare Andrews"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017834/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0137851/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3681509/","name":"Oliver Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065847/","name":"Michael Frost Beckner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0508052/","name":"Crash Leyland"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

Iron Mask
programme.desc: Tayna pechati drakona: Directed by Oleg Stepchenko. With Jason Flemyng, Xingtong Yao, Jackie Chan, Arnold Schwarzenegger. Early 1700: Cartographer Jonathan Green (Jason Flemyng) from Viy (2014) is back to map the Russian Far East. He's forced on to China, where he confronts the Dragon Master et al. The iron masked Russian Czar escapes the Tower of London to a Russian ship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6218010/","name":"Tayna pechati drakona","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2ViNDJjNzEtNmRmOS00MDA2LTljMTgtZTNiOTdhNmMzMzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTg4MDYyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Early 1700: Cartographer Jonathan Green (Jason Flemyng) from Viy (2014) is back to map the Russian Far East. He's forced on to China, where he confronts the Dragon Master et al. The iron masked Russian Czar escapes the Tower of Londo","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6218010/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"akira-hideyo"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tacky fun.","reviewBody":"What can you expect from a Jackie Chan movie? Too much, too little, too late, yes? Throw in Arnold Schwarzenegger, a few European retro stars and lots of Russian vodka lime twist with Eastern and western mythical creatures thrown into the mix and viola, 2 hours of silly whack. The acting of all the actresses are blatantly cliche and nubile so prepare to dumb down. I gave a 6 for costumes, good enough special effects, scenery and enthusiastic over acting by all the extras. It's not everyday so many get to make some coin and see Jackie and Arnold buddy up.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5864,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-08-16","keywords":"sequel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Iron Mask","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1559544089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDU3ZWU3NzUtNjQxNy00ZTVmLWE4MjctNGQ2MDM3NTk0MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDU3ZWU3NzUtNjQxNy00ZTVmLWE4MjctNGQ2MDM3NTk0MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002076/","name":"Jason Flemyng"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4080670/","name":"Xingtong Yao"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000329/","name":"Jackie Chan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1897071/","name":"Oleg Stepchenko"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0335687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0341688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0137977/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8552961/","name":"Dmitry Paltsev"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1923871/","name":"Alexey A. It's not everyday so many get to make some coin and see Jackie and Arnold buddy up.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5864,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-08-16","keywords":"sequel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Iron Mask","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1559544089","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDU3ZWU3NzUtNjQxNy00ZTVmLWE4MjctNGQ2MDM3NTk0MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDU3ZWU3NzUtNjQxNy00ZTVmLWE4MjctNGQ2MDM3NTk0MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002076/","name":"Jason Flemyng","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4080670/","name":"Xingtong Yao","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000329/","name":"Jackie Chan"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1897071/","name":"Oleg Stepchenko"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0335687/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0341688/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0137977/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8552961/","name":"Dmitry Paltsev","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1923871/","name":"Alexey A. programme.title: Solomon Kane
Solomon Kane
programme.desc:
Solomon Kane: Directed by M.J. Bassett. With James Purefoy, Mark O'Neal, Robert Orr, Richard Ryan. A ruthless mercenary renounces violence after learning his soul is bound for hell. When a young girl is kidnapped and her family slain by a sorcerer's murderous cult, he is forced to fight and seek his redemption slaying evil." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0970452/","name":"Solomon Kane","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5NDMwOTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg5OTM1OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A ruthless mercenary renounces violence after learning his soul is bound for hell. When a young girl is kidnapped and her family slain by a sorcerer's murderous cult, he is forced to fight and seek his redemption slaying evil.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0970452/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevinTasker"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Solid, old fashioned, sword and sorcery flick","reviewBody":"If you took the time to find it, then you wont be disappointed with this solid, old fashioned sword and sorcery movie.

The tales of Solomon Kane have been around longer than most, the character first appearing in mass market print back in the late twenties, but they've not been filmed. Many others, borrowing from it have been filmed so you will be quite familiar with the twists and turns having seen them elsewhere. The saving grace here is that it's all done quite well. James Purefoy is every part the tortured warrior and it's good to see Max Von Sydow and the legend that is Pete Poslethwaite up on the big screen. It's a creepy, dark movie at times and the extra effort they've put into the set design and cinematography really helps to set the scene. The story nips along to a satisfying conclusion. The fight choreography is very well done and FX are good as well.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72274,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2009-12-23","keywords":"violence,redemption,revenge,burning sword,handheld weapon","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi731555097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczMzMzNzQ2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTUwNDMxOA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczMzMzNzQ2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTUwNDMxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary who owes his soul to the devil redeems himself by fighting evil.

programme.title: Missing in Action
Missing in Action
programme.desc:
Missing in Action: Directed by Joseph Zito. With Chuck Norris, M. Emmet Walsh, David Tress, Lenore Kasdorf. Colonel Braddock launches a mission deep into the jungles of Vietnam to find the POW camp that he escaped from and free the Americans still held captive there." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0087727/","name":"Missing in Action","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRkY2M1YWMtYmZiMy00NDMzLTg0OTctYWNmNzllMGNlYmMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Colonel Braddock launches a mission deep into the jungles of Vietnam to find the POW camp that he escaped from and free the Americans still held captive there.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087727/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Nazi_Fighter_David"},"dateCreated":"2004-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ghosts of Vietnam hell haunting Norris...","reviewBody":"There has been great controversy about U.S. prisoners of war (POWs) and those missing in action (MIAs) during the Vietnam War 

While Colonel Braddock - one of the outspoken proponents of the theory that Americans are still being held in Vietnam today - is now in Saigon at the president's request to see if there are more MIAs in Vietnam 

The American delegation hopes Braddock's presence would increase their ability to negotiate But General Trau (James Hong) believes that Colonel Braddock is not a prisoner of war, but a common criminal, brought to Saigon only in an attempt to embarrass his government 

The sexy aide of Senator Porter, Lenore Kasdorf, thinks that Braddock is the most undiplomatic man she has ever met 

The action begins when the Vietnam vet - not supposed to leave the hotel without an escort - assaults General Trau's residence, pays for a bullet-proof speed riverboat and blazes his way with an old war buddy called Tuck (M. Emmet Walsh) through the jungles of Saigon 

Norris, challenging several unpredicted attacks from his enemies, takes at last his revenge after he experiences the fear, chaos and atrocities of the Vietnam hell","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14765,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1984-11-16","keywords":"vietnam war,rescue mission,one man army,prisoner of war,martial arts","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Missing in Action","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1626845721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMxYjM0YjQtZDMyNi00NGNiLThjYmQtYWFhMWUwN2MyYTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMxYjM0YjQtZDMyNi00NGNiLThjYmQtYWFhMWUwN2MyYTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Missing in Action"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001569/","name":"Chuck Norris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001826/","name":"M. Emmet Walsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0872261/","name":"David Tress"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0957263/","name":"Joseph Zito"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044937/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0206391/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798649/","name":"Arthur Silver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506062/","name":"Larry Levinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082893/","name":"Steve Bing"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Missing in Action 2: The Beginning
Missing in Action 2 – Die Rückkehr
programme.desc:
Missing in Action 2: The Beginning: Directed by Lance Hool. With Chuck Norris, Soon-Tek Oh, Steven Williams, Bennett Ohta. Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0089604/","name":"Missing in Action 2: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzODkyODg4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTQ2NjE2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0089604/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Hey_Sweden"},"dateCreated":"2013-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Action movie gold.","reviewBody":"It's not surprising to learn that Chuck Norris made this series as a tribute to his brother who had been killed in Vietnam. He really gave all that he had to these films. It may be manipulative but damn is it ever satisfying. The villains are the kind of loathsome scum whom you JUST CAN'T WAIT to see messed up in a variety of ways. And the good guys are fleshed out enough as characters that you do feel bad for them, and want to see them get their revenge.

As one can guess, this is a prequel to the original "Missing in Action" film of 1984. It shows how Chucks' colonel character, James Braddock, was shot down and captured during the war, and the tortures that he and his men are obliged to endure for the next several years, even after the war has basically ended. The sadistic colonel in charge of his work camp, Colonel Yin (Soon-Tek Oh) acts like a dictator, and just when you think you can't hate this guy any more, he ups the stakes yet again.

With Lance Hool taking the directors' reins, this proves to be a high old time for the action junkie, underscored by the genuine poignancy to be found in stories about prisoners of war. This is exciting much of the time, with kick ass battle footage, lots of explosions, lots of gunfire, and some breathtaking scenery. Chuck is a formidable hero as always, and Oh is a deliciously evil bad guy. Lending strong support are Cosie Costa, Joe Michael Terry, and especially John Wesley as the ailing Franklin. Steven Williams is good in an initially unlikable part as a captain eager to cooperate with his captors in exchange for better treatment. It's also cool to see hulking screen heavy Professor Toru Tanaka and "Ninja III: The Domination" villain David Chung as two of the guards.

All in all, this is solid entertainment, complete with a high body count and never ever boring.

Eight out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8235,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1985-03-01","keywords":"hairy chest,prequel,vietnam war veteran,soldier,missing in action","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001569/","name":"Chuck Norris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0644902/","name":"Soon-Tek Oh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931736/","name":"Steven Williams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393678/","name":"Lance Hool"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044937/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0206391/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082893/","name":"Steve Bing"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506062/","name":"Larry Levinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798649/","name":"Arthur Silver"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

With Chuck Norris, Soon-Tek Oh, Steven Williams, Bennett Ohta. Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0089604/","name":"Missing in Action 2: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzODkyODg4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTQ2NjE2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0089604/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Hey_Sweden","dateCreated":"2013-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Action movie gold.","reviewBody":"It's not surprising to learn that Chuck Norris made this series as a tribute to his brother who had been killed in Vietnam. He really gave all that he had to these films. It may be manipulative but damn is it ever satisfying. The villains are the kind of loathsome scum whom you JUST CAN'T WAIT to see messed up in a variety of ways. And the good guys are fleshed out enough as characters that you do feel bad for them, and want to see them get their revenge.

As one can guess, this is a prequel to the original "Missing in Action" film of 1984. It shows how Chucks' colonel character, James Braddock, was shot down and captured during the war, and the tortures that he and his men are obliged to endure for the next several years, even after the war has basically ended. The sadistic colonel in charge of his work camp, Colonel Yin (Soon-Tek Oh) acts like a dictator, and just when you think you can't hate this guy any more, he ups the stakes yet again.

With Lance Hool taking the directors' reins, this proves to be a high old time for the action junkie, underscored by the genuine poignancy to be found in stories about prisoners of war. This is exciting much of the time, with kick ass battle footage, lots of explosions, lots of gunfire, and some breathtaking scenery. Chuck is a formidable hero as always, and Oh is a deliciously evil bad guy. Lending strong support are Cosie Costa, Joe Michael Terry, and especially John Wesley as the ailing Franklin. Steven Williams is good in an initially unlikable part as a captain eager to cooperate with his captors in exchange for better treatment. It's also cool to see hulking screen heavy Professor Toru Tanaka and "Ninja III: The Domination" villain David Chung as two of the guards.

All in all, this is solid entertainment, complete with a high body count and never ever boring.

Eight out of 10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8235,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1985-03-01","keywords":"hairy chest,prequel,vietnam war veteran,soldier,missing in action","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001569/","name":"Chuck Norris","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0644902/","name":"Soon-Tek Oh","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931736/","name":"Steven Williams"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393678/","name":"Lance Hool"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044937/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0206391/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082893/","name":"Steve Bing","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506062/","name":"Larry Levinson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798649/","name":"Arthur Silver"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Braddock: Missing in Action III

programme.desc: Braddock: Missing in Action III: Directed by Aaron Norris. With Chuck Norris, Aki Aleong, Roland Harrah III, Miki Kim. Braddock mounts a one-man assault to free his wife and son who are still being held in a Vietnam prison camp." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0094792/","name":"Braddock: Missing in Action III","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRjODU0MTUtMjBmMi00ZTBmLTk2MDYtOWQzYjg1M2FiZDJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY3MjUzNDk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Braddock mounts a one-man assault to free his wife and son who are still being held in a Vietnam prison camp.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0094792/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"soranno"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"A little rehashed but not entirely bad","reviewBody":"In the wake of "Rambo 3" and a bunch of police action thrillers with Vietnam War veterans or references and homages to the war as well as the recent hits of Oliver Stone and Stanley Kubrick, "Braddock: Missing In Action 3" doesn't have a shot in accomplishing anything original since similar material has already been done way too many times before during the second half of the 1980's. However, Chuck Norris' starring role as the Vietnam War veteran who goes on another deadly mission to rescue more POW's prevents this film from being a complete downer but doesn't prevent it from becoming too routine."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6336,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","War"],"datePublished":"1988-01-22","keywords":"kung fu,cult film,vietnam war veteran,aerial camera shot,child in jeopardy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3352937241","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjAwMTkzZjAtZTc3MC00OGRmLWIwMGItZjY3MTllOWYwYWJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjAwMTkzZjAtZTc3MC00OGRmLWIwMGItZjY3MTllOWYwYWJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Braddock mounts a one-man assault to free his wife and son who are still being held in a Vietnam prison camp."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001569/","name":"Chuck Norris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0018080/","name":"Aki Aleong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364036/","name":"Roland Harrah III"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0635760/","name":"Aaron Norris"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044937/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0206391/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0798649/","name":"Arthur Silver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506062/","name":"Larry Levinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082893/","name":"Steve Bing"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Molly's Game
Molly's Game – Alles auf eine Karte
programme.desc: Molly's Game: Directed by Aaron Sorkin. With Jessica Chastain, Idris Elba, Kevin Costner, Michael Cera. The true story of Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game and became an FBI target." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4209788/","name":"Molly's Game","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkzMzRlYjEtMTQ5Yi00OWY3LWI0NzYtNGQ4ZDkzZTU0M2IwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game and became an FBI target.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4209788/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"VisualConnoisseur"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"A movie without harmony","reviewBody":"Molly's Game feels like a movie without the center of gravity. It tries to carry itself on overanalysed, emotionally insignificant environmental details. Methodologically explained poker games are captivating the first few times, but get incredibly dull and underwhelming in the second half of the movie, feeling like redundant content. The protagonist is unable to pull the overexplained and "all over the place" narrative into one harmonious puzzle. When at the end Molly and her father discuss the memories of the past, the movie attempts to have a significant emotional culmination but ends with nothing more but a shallow and uninspired moral of the story - check the path before you follow it.\n\nI would give this movie two stars, but there are some solid performances (especially from Idris Elba). Therefore my score is 4."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":159132,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-05","keywords":"poker,lawyer,trial,court,female protagonist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer With Commentary From Director Aaron Sorkin","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1887483929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhZTM2NDYtZGU2MS00YThmLTk3OTMtNDRjY2ZjY2EwYWI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhZTM2NDYtZGU2MS00YThmLTk3OTMtNDRjY2ZjY2EwYWI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Aaron Sorkin annotates the theatrical trailer for 'Molly's Game' to give you more insight to his movie."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1567113/","name":"Jessica Chastain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252961/","name":"Idris Elba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000126/","name":"Kevin Costner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0815070/","name":"Aaron Sorkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0249694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0581352/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0085751/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0815070/","name":"Aaron Sorkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6591098/","name":"Molly Bloom"}],"duration":"PT2H20M"}</script><metacontent="

Jugend ohne Gott
programme.desc:
Jugend ohne Gott: Directed by Alain Gsponer. With Jannis Niewöhner, Fahri Yardim, Emilia Schüle, Alicia von Rittberg. German students compete to enter one of the country's elite schools." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5651338/","name":"Jugend ohne Gott","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEwOGE5Y2YtMGU3Yi00MGU0LWIyYWItMmU1MTliZjM4N2UwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"German students compete to enter one of the country's elite schools.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5651338/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"s3276169"},"dateCreated":"2018-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Remarkable in a very understated way.....","reviewBody":"Godless Youth is actually based on a novel that takes place during the Fascist period in Germany in the 1930's. Its been adapted to modern times and wiped clean of any direct Nazi inference but the message remains unchanged. 

A society that robs people of privacy, intimacy and emotional integrity whilst injecting fear and control always was and always will be dehumanizing. Godless Youth examines these issues by offering a quietly understated, voice to truth. 

This is by no means a fast paced film.Its slow burn and brings things together gradually by showing you a key event from the perspectives of different players. In have to say it was not what I expected but it all works beautifully when the threads of the story are drawn together.. 

All in all a modest yet remarkable film. 8/10 from me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1596,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2017-08-31","keywords":"male objectification,bare chested male,reference to god,male nudity,male full frontal nudity","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1753704/","name":"Jannis Niewöhner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1689177/","name":"Fahri Yardim"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2163092/","name":"Emilia Schüle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1312629/","name":"Alain Gsponer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071976/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1511407/","name":"Alex Buresch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1150377/","name":"Matthias Pacht"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902463/","name":"Ödön von Horvath"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Patriot
Der Patriot
programme.desc:
The Patriot: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson, Jason Isaacs. Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0187393/","name":"The Patriot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjE4ODU0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTI2OTk2._V1_.jpg","description":"Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0187393/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Raptorclaw155"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as Bad as I Remember, but still has Issues","reviewBody":"The Patriot is a film that I've always had mixed feelings about. After seeing it again recently, I think I have a more coherent idea of how I feel about this film.

To sum this film up neatly, it is a retelling of the story we know in Braveheart, with some alterations and being slightly worse.

From a historical standpoint, The Patriot is about as historically accurate as Braveheart - that meaning that it really isn't. By now, many have already meticulously picked apart its inaccuracies so I won't really dwell on it too much. But as a piece of popular cinema, I don't think this film's intention is to be historically accurate anyway.

The Patriot is an impressive looking film, I believe. The action sequences are exciting to watch and the scale of the battles are appropriate enough where there aren't noticeable CGI people also partaking in the fight.

Speaking of the CG effects, they are looking a bit dated now. Some of the computer generated blue screen backgrounds don't look very convincing, especially when they go to Charles Town at the beginning of the film. But since the shots don't dwell too much on them, it's not too bi a deal, I believe.

The acting performances aren't bad at all. Mel Gibson found his niche after Braveheart and went with it and his performance here translates incredibly well. The actors that portray the various British officers in this film do put on a bit of a James Bond villain performance and it does get a little distracting, but there is some complexity in the writing at times that makes up for that in those moments.

It's also to be noted that the soundtrack for this film is amazing. Of course, this is the work of John Williams and it goes extraordinarily well when paired with this film. It is the shining aspect of this film and I cannot compliment it enough. It has to be one of the more underrated works John Williams has done.

Where this film ultimately loses me is when it comes to the issue of slavery. I understand this is among the myriad of other historical inaccuracies with this film, but it's this particular aspect of American history that really hurts it the most. The most obvious example of this is when the workers on Martin's farm say that they work his land but are not slaves. It is also framed in this film that the British army offering freedom to any slave who serves with them is a bad thing, but later when the American army announces something similar, suddenly it's righteous. This, of course, wasn't the case and it's very misleading. There's a scene in the film where Gabriel makes a promise that once the British are defeated, the old world will be pushed out and a new world can be built; one where all people are free. This is so obviously untrue but the film ignores it. As a result, it feels like the one slave character shown in the whole film is duped into serving with the continentals just to be enslaved again once the eventual government decides, through inaction, that slavery is necessary. I get images of the American Civil War in my mind every time I see that scene, and it's that scene that really hurts this film the most- but ironically enough, maybe the most accurate part of it...

The Patriot is interesting. I feel it's a bit long. Granted, I'm just coming from seeing the extended cut but I do think this film could have gone without some things. Not horrible if you're looking for a fictional story that takes place in a real time in history. Just don't use it as an educational tool unless you're going to talk about the uniforms and clothing of that period.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2000-07-19","keywords":"american revolution,hero,standoff,father son relationship,george washington character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Patriot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi100139289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxNjY2N2MtNjllYy00OGE1LTgxMmYtZjYwOTc2MzEyYzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxNjY2N2MtNjllYy00OGE1LTgxMmYtZjYwOTc2MzEyYzVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Touchstone Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000613/","name":"Joely Richardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050111/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007500/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734441/","name":"Robert Rodat"}],"duration":"PT2H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Two Weeks Notice
Ein Chef zum Verlieben
programme.desc:
Two Weeks Notice: Directed by Marc Lawrence. With Sandra Bullock, Hugh Grant, Alicia Witt, Dana Ivey. A lawyer decides that she's used too much like a nanny by her boss, so she walks out on him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0313737/","name":"Two Weeks Notice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTg4N2M2ODItZjVjMy00YTljLTllNjUtYzY4ZTE2MTI2M2RhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lawyer decides that she's used too much like a nanny by her boss, so she walks out on him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313737/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AvidClimber"},"dateCreated":"2013-01-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Two Weeks Notice — A romantic comedy about opposites who work together without clashing","reviewBody":"Two Weeks Notice is a conventional story done in an unconventional way. The two characters are total opposite and yet, no real clashes happens. The movie even refrained from doing an over exaggerated introduction of them. They both are presented in strong terms, yes, but not over done.

If you can't stand easy witty wordy humor like Hugh Grant so charmingly display in this piece, something he excels at, you better not watch it. It's those dialogs that propel this movie forward. He does it in an unpretentious earnest way, which is why Lucy Kelson (Sandra Bullock) ends up working for him.

The story is simple, the photography very good, and nothing is out of place. This film doesn't reinvent the genre, but it's a very well built offspring.

See it for good entertainment.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114725,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-03-05","keywords":"donald trump character,reference to the new york mets,reference to the san francisco giants,community center,protest","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Two Weeks Notice","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3170435353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI2ZDdlNGItMGEyMy00MDU1LTkyMGItMjM3MmQ2MThhNTE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI2ZDdlNGItMGEyMy00MDU1LTkyMGItMjM3MmQ2MThhNTE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000424/","name":"Hugh Grant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001860/","name":"Alicia Witt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492909/","name":"Marc Lawrence"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024939/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492909/","name":"Marc Lawrence"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Bourne Identity
Die Bourne-Identität
programme.desc:
The Bourne Identity: Directed by Doug Liman. With Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Chris Cooper, Clive Owen. A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0258463/","name":"The Bourne Identity","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2JkNGU0ZGMtZjVjNS00NjgyLWEyOWYtZmRmZGQyN2IxZjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0258463/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CAMACHO-4"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best spy films around","reviewBody":"This story has been done several times in the past, most recently in "A Long Kiss Goodnight". It's also true that Doug Liman and the producers created their own Jason Bourne mythology,since this movie is different in many ways to the book. But the truth is Liman takes an old story and puts a new fast paced spin on it.

Matt Damon stars as the enigmatic assassin who just wants to figure out who he is. As he travels from city to city he's followed by CIA agents who want to dispose of him to save their own jobs. He's helped along the way by Marie played by the brilliant Franka Potente. Together they come face to face with the people that want them dead.

The cast is great and so is the story. This film should be on everyone's top ten list.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":529574,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-09-25","keywords":"amnesia,secret past,money,assassin,dark past","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Bourne Identity","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi680919321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZkYTZjNTctNjkzOS00YjAzLTk5MTgtMGQwYWJiODI5MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZkYTZjNTctNjkzOS00YjAzLTk5MTgtMGQwYWJiODI5MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004376/","name":"Franka Potente"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177933/","name":"Chris Cooper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013175/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035615/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006904/","name":"Tony Gilroy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0380819/","name":"W. programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
Die Bourne-Verschwörung
programme.desc:
The Bourne Supremacy: Directed by Paul Greengrass. With Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Brian Cox, Julia Stiles. When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0372183/","name":"The Bourne Supremacy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIyMDFmMmItMWQzYy00MjBiLTg2M2UtM2JiNDRhOWE4NjBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0372183/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pied"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Superior Action Film...","reviewBody":"This is a superior action film with the added bonus of good acting by Joan Allen, Matt Damon, and Karl Urban among others. The camera work is amazing.

I especially liked the on-locale settings of Russia and Germany.

Jason Bourne is a walking CIA specimen whom the agency deems to dangerous to live. Not all the facts are known about some mysterious murders in Berlin but Jason Bourne is suspected. You know his idyllic life on a remote island will be blown from the first.

How this all is resolved takes the viewer on a non-stop chase through various foreign countries. 

Good flick!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":450534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-08-25","keywords":"hidden truth,suspense,secret past,dark past,amnesia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004376/","name":"Franka Potente"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000260/","name":"Joan Allen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339030/","name":"Paul Greengrass"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143778/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013175/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524924/","name":"Robert Ludlum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006904/","name":"Tony Gilroy"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="
